name: TYC 8998-760-1
scenarioDescription:
The TYC 8998-760-1 Exoplanetary System

TYC 8998-760-1 is a star with 1 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.032 times its radius. It is located 308.54 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.017 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TYC 8998-760-1 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

TYC 8998-760-1 b

TYC 8998-760-1 b was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory using the imaging method. Its discovery was announced in 2020-02. Its semi-major axis is 162.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit.

The mass of TYC 8998-760-1 b is 4449.35 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TYC 8998-760-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

TYC 8998-760-1 c

TYC 8998-760-1 c was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory using the imaging method. Its discovery was announced in 2020-07. Its semi-major axis is 320.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit.

The mass of TYC 8998-760-1 c is 1906.86 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TYC 8998-760-1 c is 12.33 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TYC 8998-760-1 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TYC 8998-760-1, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Paranal Observatory.
